hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification via BTC Spot-ETF Flow Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: A CPI print that surprises consensus by >0.2% (up or down) will trigger a directional move in BTC that is amplified by a same-day divergence between spot price action and US Spot Bitcoin ETF net flows, with the amplified move continuing for 24-48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Macro catalysts (CPI) set initial direction, but ETF flows represent institutional conviction. Divergent flows (e.g., buying into bad news) signal stronger underlying demand/supply than the headline suggests, amplifying the move as algorithmic and momentum traders pile in.
entry_conditions: US CPI print released, absolute deviation from consensus forecast >= 0.2%
BTC 1-hour candle closes in direction of surprise (up for lower CPI, down for higher CPI)

Within 4 hours of CPI release, US Spot Bitcoin ETF aggregate net flows (Bloomberg/SoSoValue data) show divergence: Positive flows on a down CPI surprise day OR negative flows on an up CPI surprise day.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move from entry price in the direction of the initial amplified move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Reversal of >50% of the initial 4-hour move post-CPI

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A >0.2% CPI surprise followed by the described ETF flow divergence fails to produce a sustained directional move (>2% in 24h) more than 50% of the time in a neutral/bull regime.
